info.description: Use these REST APIs for performing operations on Email Templates associated with your Azure API Management deployment.
info.title: ApiManagementClient

get.description: Lists a collection of properties defined within a service instance.

parameters.description: The name of the resource group.
parameters.name: resourceGroupName

parameters.description: The name of the API Management service.
parameters.name: serviceName

parameters.description: Number of records to return.
parameters.name: $top

parameters.description: Number of records to skip.
parameters.name: $skip

parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request.
parameters.name: api-version

parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.
parameters.name: subscriptionId

200.description: A Collection of the Email Template for the specified API Management service instance.

type.description: Resource type for API Management resource.

body.description: Email Template Body. This should be a valid XDocument

isDefault.description: Whether the template is the default template provided by Api Management or has been edited.

parameters.description: Email Template Parameter values.

properties.body:
Dear $DevFirstName $DevLastName,

We are happy to let you know that your request to publish the $AppName application in the application gallery has been approved. Your application has been published and can be viewed here.

Best,

The $OrganizationName API Team
properties.description: Developers who submitted their application for publication in the application gallery on the developer portal receive this email after their submission is approved.
properties.subject: Your application $AppName is published in the application gallery
properties.title: Application gallery submission approved

delete.description: Reset the Email Template to default template provided by the API Management service instance.

parameters.description: The name of the resource group.
parameters.name: resourceGroupName

parameters.description: The name of the API Management service.
parameters.name: serviceName

parameters.description: Email Template Name Identifier.
parameters.name: templateName

parameters.description: ETag of the Entity. ETag should match the current entity state from the header response of the GET request or it should be * for unconditional update.
parameters.name: If-Match

parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request.
parameters.name: api-version

parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.
parameters.name: subscriptionId

200.description: Email Template was successfully reset to default.

204.description: Email Template was successfully reset to default.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

code.description: Service-defined error code. This code serves as a sub-status for the HTTP error code specified in the response.

details.description: The list of invalid fields send in request, in case of validation error.

get.description: Gets the details of the email template specified by its identifier.

parameters.description: The name of the resource group.
parameters.name: resourceGroupName

parameters.description: The name of the API Management service.
parameters.name: serviceName

parameters.description: Email Template Name Identifier.
parameters.name: templateName

parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request.
parameters.name: api-version

parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.
parameters.name: subscriptionId

200.description: The response body contains the specified Email template.

ETag.description: Current entity state version. Should be treated as opaque and used to make conditional HTTP requests.

type.description: Resource type for API Management resource.

body.description: Email Template Body. This should be a valid XDocument

isDefault.description: Whether the template is the default template provided by Api Management or has been edited.

parameters.description: Email Template Parameter values.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

code.description: Service-defined error code. This code serves as a sub-status for the HTTP error code specified in the response.

details.description: The list of invalid fields send in request, in case of validation error.

properties.body:
Dear $DevFirstName $DevLastName,

Thank you for contacting us. Our API team will review your issue and get back to you soon.

Click this link to view or edit your request.

Best,

The $OrganizationName API Team
properties.description: This email is sent to developers after they create a new topic on the Issues page of the developer portal.
properties.subject: Your request $IssueName was received
properties.title: New issue received

head.description: Gets the entity state (Etag) version of the email template specified by its identifier.

parameters.description: The name of the resource group.
parameters.name: resourceGroupName

parameters.description: The name of the API Management service.
parameters.name: serviceName

parameters.description: Email Template Name Identifier.
parameters.name: templateName

parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request.
parameters.name: api-version

parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.
parameters.name: subscriptionId

200.description: Specified email template entity exists and current entity state version is present in the ETag header.

ETag.description: Current entity state version. Should be treated as opaque and used to make conditional HTTP requests.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

code.description: Service-defined error code. This code serves as a sub-status for the HTTP error code specified in the response.

details.description: The list of invalid fields send in request, in case of validation error.

parameters.description: The name of the resource group.
parameters.name: resourceGroupName

parameters.name: templateName

parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request.
parameters.name: api-version

parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.
parameters.name: subscriptionId

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

code.description: Service-defined error code. This code serves as a sub-status for the HTTP error code specified in the response.

details.description: The list of invalid fields send in request, in case of validation error.

properties.body:
Dear $DevFirstName $DevLastName,

We are happy to let you know that your request to publish the $AppName application in the gallery has been approved. Your application has been published and can be viewed here.

Best,

The $OrganizationName API Team
properties.subject: Your application $AppName is published in the gallery
